creator: bjoernv@arcor.de
text:
Microsoft's explorer is in some setups not capable to display modification dates
in folder views. All other columns (filename, internet address, file type, size)
are displayed correctly. 

This is the setup:
Apache:
- Apache 2.2.3 with mod_dav, dav_fs, auth_basic, ssl modules
- openSUSE Linux 10.2
- configuration: Basic authentication, SSL, DAV On

Windows:
- Windows XP Home Edition with SP2 (German)
- Internet Explorer 7 (the problem is not new since v7)
- a web folder to the above Apache server

The screenshots show the same folder within MS explorer (no modification dates)
and Konqueror (KDE, modification dates).

Because of SSL it's not possible to sniff the protocol in current setup.

Is it possible to sniff the protocol within Apache or MS explorer (protocol
trace files)?

creator: bjoernv@arcor.de
text:
Created attachment 19741
Screenshot: MS explorer does not show the modification dates

creator: bjoernv@arcor.de
text:
Created attachment 19742
Screenshot: Konqueror shows the modification dates correctly

creator: rpluem@apache.org
text:
Please have a look at the following URL's for some of these oddities:

http://www.greenbytes.de/tech/webdav/webfolder-client-list.html
http://www.greenbytes.de/tech/webdav/webdav-redirector-list.html

Regarding sniffing the content: Please have a look at

http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/en/mod/mod_dumpio.html
If konqueror does it correctly it does not seem to be a bug for me in httpd.
creator: rpluem@apache.org
